title: Drawing, Main altar
medium: pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d and 457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. The lower part is a variation of -1369, the round pedestals having a smaller diameter, the connecting walls being longer. Statues stand upon the pedestals. In the center of the retable is a picture of an Ascension. On either side are three columns, the central one is projecting. Above the entablature is a framed panel with a representation. Beside it are two sitting angels. On top of it is a base with two angels, adoring the cross, which is supported by a kneeling figure. Usual background.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Main altar. pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1378.
